offScreen(int, int) - Method in class Game2.Animal
returns true if the Animal is off screen (accounting for imageWidth)
offScreenDetectionTest() - Method in class Game2.AnimalTest
 
onClick(MouseEvent) - Method in class Game2.CrabCatcherGame
Checks if the user clicked an animal and update game accordingly
onClick(MouseEvent) - Method in class Game3.Game3
The player can click on the button to exit the game OR Click on a tile and the method will prompt the player for which plant they want to place If the player clicks on a plant to buy, this will prompt the player to place the plant If the player clicks on a Mussel, the mussel is harvested for money and a new mussel appears If the player clicks on the exit button, the game will pause and prompt them to exit WITHOUT sending the score or setting the game complete boolean to true
onClickForTesting(int, int) - Method in class Game3.Game3
This method is used for testing the onClick method without simulating clicks.
onClickTest(int, int) - Method in class Game2.CrabCatcherGame
Method for testing click events
onTick(CrabCatcherGame) - Method in class Game2.Animal
updates animal's timed elements (movement, animation, and offScreen check)
onTickAndMoveAndImagesTest() - Method in class Game2.AnimalTest
 
onTickTest(int, int, int) - Method in class Game2.Animal
for testing purposes only; updates animal's timed elements but only takes time and game dimensions instead of game object
openImage - Variable in class OverallGame.gameWindow

OverallGame() - Constructor for class OverallGame.OverallGame
Constructor Default Values Overall score = 0 gamesComplete = [false, false, false] gameRunning = true highscores = read from file timeInIdel = 0 game1 = null game2 = null game3 = null gamesRunning (0 if overall, 1 if game1, 2 if game2, 3 if game3)
